Name: Dungarubba
Title: An enjoyable few hours with lots of great shops and places to eat
Review: I enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere here. The shop assistants were all helpful but didn't follow me around like so many others do in India. The Anokhi and Fabindia stores were both well stocked and large, and there was a great choice of cafes and restaurants as well as fresh fruit and groceries so I was happy. There was a lot more to see, so if you visit, allow plenty of time to browse and enjoy yourself. Parking was also good when we arrived at about 11am

Name: GenX
Title: NIce place
Review: Beautiful place of the Delhi and useful with good market of all products .  here you can buy product at good price.

Name: ianwyj
Title: Good for a wander and a meal
Review: I was staying in a hotel just a few minutes' walk away from Khan Market, and it was an easy decision to spend a couple of hours wandering around the area.  It's not a large market in terms of size but there appeared to be something for most visitors - fashion outlet, jewellery, electronic goods, money changers, bookstores, mobile phone merchants, and custom repairs all featured.  And I also managed to get a filling meal at one of the many intriguing restaurants, most of which had entrances on the inner lane.

Name: Brijesh shah
Title: Place to Spend free time
Review: A place to visit in your free time , when you are in Delhi , I bet you will be having fun over there. You can have all types of best quality foods , shopping of all items and many more.

Name: ScubaJoJo
Title: Little bit of this, little of that
Review: You can find all bits and bobs here, kinda like an up market market. There are shops rather than stalls, some basic others luxurious.  Bonus - 3 pet shops!! Couldn't find a nail salon but a few hairdressers.  Lots of eateries to choose from.

Name: Vanshika C
Title: Fun day
Review: Today I visited this very beautiful cafe in Khan Market and had such droolworthy and delicious food here.They served the best shrimps and paneer tikka and otb bomb was my favourite drink I had so far.Must try!

Name: Ays Espiritu
Title: Not what I expected
Review: A part of our tour in the city is a market shopping, so I expected to find a nice local market offering locally produced items. Khan Market also offers that but it is more for tourists or foreigners living in the area with a budget.A local staff later on told me that it is a posh and expensive market. Expensive indeed but not really posh. The place is already run-down.There are expensive, branded and high quality brands but the shops are really small. I enjoyed shopping for fruits though!I think the big shopping malls are a better alternative if you want to shop for branded and high quality brands conveniently. Or if you want to shop in a local Indian market, there are some place else.

Name: PowerPasta
Title: Lovely wander
Review: Great place to wander and window shop. Some lovely place to eat here as well. Some shops e pensive, but quality is good.

Name: Smokey128
Title: Best place to shop
Review: This for my Friend and I was the best place to shop in Delhi. The choice of shop was remarkable, the quality of the goods on offer fabulous and we did not find the prices steep for what was on offer. There are also a wonderful array of beautiful little coffee shops in the market offering little cakes and stunning coffee. Give yourself time to visit the entire market as it is quite large.

Name: David S
Title: Disappointing market
Review: We visited this market - it was disappointing - the shops were too modern and very expensive and we found it hard to get a local meal. Try the India Art market about  2km away - more authentic.

Name: Maria P
Title: Beautiful shops but expensive
Review: Really lovely shopping here - not a "market" more shops as in a higher class area.  Wish I could afford some of the gorgeous dresses.

Name: Reem
Title: "A must visit" Traditional Market
Review: It's a traditional market where you will find textiles, tailoring accessories, street food, precious stones and other things.The place is crowded and polluted, make sure to wear your face mask and take care of your personal belongings.

Name: fozjon
Title: ou "go to" market in Delhi
Review: we can pretty much buy everything we want at Khan Market. There are great grocery stores with western goods and many other shops that sell things, at least, that we as foreigners want.

Name: UKGlobalTraveller
Title: My favourite place to shop and explore
Review: Loved this place .. loads of great shops - check our Good Earth .. great variety of places to eat - bakeries (sugar and spice being my absolute favourite) .. easy to navigate .. not as crowded as the others around Delhi and much more upmarket .. no hawkers .. no beggars .. and Tuk Tuks can’t go inside so they’ll drop you off outside .. they generally will tell you it’s all designer labels that you can get anywhere else which is total nonsense .. there are loads of interesting and quirky (quality and priced accordingly) stores that cater to men and women .. definitely visit, have a mooch, but something unique and have a coffe/cake/lunch and/or drink .. My favourite place in Delhi ...

Name: Anoop Khullar
Title: Business Meet
Review: Coffee Beans and tea Leaf, Khan Market, Perfect place for a Good meal in between hours of Business, or evening, Casual seating, light music and a Good Small Menu serving Variety of Sanwiches,Pastry ,Beverages etc .Grilled Chicken and Cheese, Chicken Hawwain Sandwiches were very Good, Iced Cofee Latte , and choice of Coffees and Teas.rs 1200 for two.Recommended.

Name: Nelia L
Title: Safe, relaxed shopping and strolling
Review: Not as busy and local as other markets, nice bookshops and coffee&pastry shops. No hassling and in a posh part of Delhi, so not as interesting as other markets.

Name: racheb_10
Title: Excellent food and shopping
Review: We loved the Perch restaurant (great wine) and a Parsi option called Soda Bottle Opener Wala. Great shopping at Fabindia and Anhoki (clothes and home). Great bookstores. And much more.

Name: Didi M
Title: Very orderly gem
Review: Some people told me Khan Market was overpriced.  There's a wide variety from el cheapo to expensive (such as Amrapauli Jewellery) but it's your choice.  Khan is probably my favorite market for gift shopping and just wandering. The touts are not as intrusive and in your face as most other markets.

Name: RajeeS
Title: High-end market
Review: Love walking through the shops here. Nice cafes to stop for bites. Please go to Barisons, the book shop. It’s at the main entrance to the market, you can spend hours here. I’ve gone to Anokhi on several visits, and they’ve been very consistent with their poor service. They are such a put off, nothing changes there. Playclan has some nice quirky dresses and shirts, it’s a small set up but good service. Other than that, it’s nice to spend a free day at the market without the haggling of other markets.

Name: Ghadeer2014
Review: Khan market was Established in 1951. It is a U-shaped double story complexes. It was busy and crowded in the morning. It is a good destination for shoppers looking for fashion, jewellery and reasonably prices good. There is something for everyone.

Name: HuntleyNewYork
Title: Not worth the visit
Review: It’s just a jumble of stores that don’t look all that great and don’t offer anything fantastic. Would not recommend.

Name: speckles
Title: EVERYTHING UNDER THE SUN
Review: Incredible place.  Don’t take a car as it is hard to park. Just Uber or tuk tuk over.  There is a small apple store as well as many other cell phone and electronics stores, fabric and clothing stores, restaurants, at least three pet stores.  I was searching for a very specific cable to fit my headset into an airplane socket and after trying three places found SAI gadgets which had an assortment of cables and adapters.  They even tried to set up out to make sure it worked.

Name: amit.fotos
Title: Good place
Review: Khan market is one of a Kind market in delhi. designers store up here are top notch. And lot of great restaurants too make your stomach feel good.

Name: Kalyan Peri
Title: Charming marketplace!
Review: Clean marketplace with variety of shops, cafes and restaurants including 2-3 extremely popular book stores. The layout is akin to concentric circles/ovals with multiple shops situated on the second floor as well. Pretty popular with tourists. Great place to take a stroll and do some window shopping or a grab a coffee/drink/bite

Name: Yhuang Tsaki
Title: Great place
Review: A place aure to visit if one is in a mood to grab up nice and varied stuff from India. We can easily get nemerous kinds of stuff at cheap prices amd with a good quality.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Better shops and less hectic than a local market
Review: Khan Market is a retail and shopping district in the Rabindra Nagar area of New Delhi. The market is located in some of the most well to do districts of Delhi and unsurprisingly, the shops are ranked as some of the most expensive in India. Khan market is much more organized and cleaner than local markets. While expensive, it’s a great place to shop and hang out especially for foreigners looking for something less hectic than a local market.

Name: Sunil
Title: Khan's market
Review: The place is very old and you can find varieties of products in single place and you can buy clothes for quite cheap

Name: chikpick
Title: A good shopping experience
Review: Closed on sundays, this market is a well known costly market. At any time one can see many foreigners shopping mainly because of its location. All exotic fruits and grocery items are available. Also various expensive brand stores are there. Many restaurants serving alcohol and various cuisines are also located. In all a good place to shop, dine and stroll around.

Name: Ellen B
Title: Excellent Shopping
Review: Each trip we have stopped here to shop at the book store, stationary store, Anokhi, Fabindia, and get coffee. You can get a lot done in a couple of hours.

Name: sangeeta jindal
Title: Casual visit
Review: Khan market has the old school charm, with its small lanes and bylanes.It has both upmarket shops as well as roadside market,it's a cool hang out joint for youngsters too. It has khan cha-cha, many outlets of  Dayal Opticians, numerous salons, Big Chill and many more. In winters it's an ideal place to chill with its many book stores.

Name: Chloe Augustin
Title: Cute market area
Review: Charming market with clean streets and lots of shops and cafes. It’s not like a local market but more looks it’s built for tourists. All cafes are on the second floor of the buildings.

Name: URP70
Title: Lovely market to discover surprising gift items
Review: Beautiful market with most of the high end brands here but what i liked was small nook store where you could discover fancy gift items within your budget. found a few and bought some great gifts for friends and family. Also window shopped for pricey brands to see what is there in the market.

Name: Janine B
Title: INTERESTING MARKET
Review: Take you r driver with you as they know where to go, lovely exciting market.Do not wander alone, you will be harassed continuously by folk wanting to sell their goods.

Name: Jasmine C
Title: While away the hours and shop in peace
Review: Nice place to get away from the bustle, still busy but you can pop from shop to shop very easy without any hastle, all the usual such a fabindia and anokhi, designers and grocers, shops selling traditional products also. It is pricier than street market but a much more chilled experience. Great restaurants and bars also. Easy to while away the hours...

Name: BayareaMom
Title: Love this market!!! 👏👏👏👍
Review: I have grown to love this market over the years. In my younger years, I found it expensive, but as I am crunched for time on my India visits with family, I find this market addresses all my needs with very little hassle. Stores like Cottons Jaipur and Fab India have better stuff here compared to their other stores. I can say the same for food too.

Name: orielh
Title: Underwhelming
Review: I expected great things of this market, it having been recommended by a friend who lived in Delhi for many years. In the event I was disappointed. There are a handful of internationally recognised brands like Marks and Spencer, Bodyshop, W H Smith etc and lots  of other units selling food, fabrics etc. It was difficult to find good a coffee shop with wifi. It was an interesting experience but I'm open minded about whether I'd go again.

Name: Alwaystravellinng
Title: Safe, less hassle and good food too
Review: Not the typical Delhi shopping experience as no hawkers hastling you and time to relax if you need a quick bout of retail therapy. Shops are probably more expensive but good staff and good range of products. Make a couple of hours and conclude with a quick dinner as an alternative to the hotel.

Name: Robert K
Title: All in one - easy to get everything.
Review: Meals, gifts, clothes, you name it you will find it here. Things may be more expensive but the convenience and time are worth the additional cost.

Name: Shobha
Title: Lot of rush
Review: There was lot of rush when we visited here . But the market was good . It was worth visiting here . U can find good discounts on products in this market . Bought some cloths and cosmetics from here .

Name: Rickard B
Title: Not that interesting..
Review: Perhaps I was bit early. But there were nothing special to see here.. random shops with standard stuff

Name: Sanjeev Takyar
Title: Chaotic market
Review: Overhyped, overpriced, market with no easy parking, jams inside the market, not enough space for walking, the restaurants on first floor have very steep staircase, and barely one person can walk at a time in these stairs, otherwise good for shopping with designer stores and abundance of restaurants, plus point, you get all imported stuff here in food but check the expiry, the shopkeepers are not courteous.

Name: sharjeelcool
Title: Good
Review: I must say this is definitely one of the best places if you want to indulge in some shopping.it has so much to offer

Name: David Keane
Title: THIS MARKET IS SO COOL.
Review: I spent a rainy evening prodding around the small allies full of shops selling clothes and different cloths. The prices were expensive for India but it is still cheaper than the West. One reason to go is the quality of the gifts will be better than cheaper markets I believe. There is a cafe there with movie posters which makes a lovely latte and toasted cheese and tomato sandwich.My friend got a haircut for 150 Indian Rupees and it turned out great, A great place to goto.

Name: curious_and.curiouser
Title: The place to see and be seen
Review: Very hipster place offering more upscale shopping and F&B, think Anoki, Fabindia, Good Earth etc. Adjust your budget accordingly and you'll be in for a good time. Saw lots of well-heeled folk arriving in the evening in style in big expensive cars, looks like Khan Market is the place to see and be seen, definitely the go-to spot for a great night out. If you're looking for more down to earth shopping, go to Janpath Market.

Name: Manava
Title: Hang out
Review: From food to shoping everything is here. Good brands are there. Delhi clothes, kudtas all you get.  This place is modern and cool. Some of the best food joints are here. Lots of parking too. Beware of shops that sell local stuff at High rates.

Name: Gurukohli
Title: Great choice of shopping and eating places
Review: Khan market is located near a lot of tourist attractions and is a good place for a lunch or supper break and some shoppingWhether you are looking for books or clothes or souvenirs , you will find a shop for it in Khan marketSome great restaurants for western , local and regional food and nice cafes - this place has it allParking is a challenge though

Name: mkhaki2016
Title: Great variety of shops if you have limited time in Delhi
Review: This is my one stop shopping and dining place in South Delhi. Behri Sons is a must stop for books and it has an impressive range, including some obscure titles that my Toronto friend saddles me with - I always have trouble finding his titles in Mumbai and Kolkata - here I was 7 for 7 for his and 10 for 5 form me (I ended up buying way more that I was planning to!)Excellent clothing stores, prices are high, but you get what you pay for! There's even a Fabindia store. Good choice of restaurants.  Make sure that you are clear about prices in the fruit stores. The one I walked into I bought fruit that is hard to find in Toronto. However, a box of Jamun, 1 kg of fresh dates and 4 custard apples cost me almost CAD$30. It is always the "helpful" shop assistant that piles up your basket, and I suppose I was not diligent enough. It's just that one does not expect that they would stiff foreigners in an upscale shopping mall.

Name: RE_S_Ph
Title: Good Shopping Spot in Delhi
Review: Upscale shopping precint in Delhi with good restaurants and bookstores.You will also find upscale homeware stores in this area.

Name: Asbhist
Title: Excellent Market
Review: I am a regular visiter to this market .It has very good eateries lots of choice/quinines.Great place for meeting friends

Name: pallavi c
Title: Mix of high-end and street shopping
Review: It's old Delhi market, has stores of high priced boutiques and brands and also fashion street. Has many good restaurants with small entries in busy market which makes it interesting to look at.

Name: Joe Torrico
Title: Really Interesting Place
Review: Khan Market is a fun place to shop, eat, and hang out with other people. It’s a great place to go to do stuff at a good price.

Name: Malini Srivastava
Title: Khan Market-Place for expats and rich Indians
Review: Good place to hang out with friends as all the cafes serve fresh food and drinks here.Those who do not smoke should not go here as in most  restaurants they have given a place to smoke.Street shopping is expensive here as lot of foreigners come here.

Name: MReitsema
Title: Spoilt for choice
Review: This is a lovely market to pickup literally anything you need. There are great restaurants too choose from. The locals say this is the most expensive market to go to but the quality is way better than the other markets.

Name: Anoop Khullar
Title: Birthday dinner
Review: Good family  place and accommodative staff.Menu with lot of offerings, Combo meals with beverages,We enjoyed , Six Chilly Burger and Penne Alfredo for children was very good.Good Atmosphere ,ask for Offers going.well Recomended.

Name: Traveler
Title: Very interesting 😎
Review: Worth visiting Comes a live after 9pm Boutique market Full of interesting people Locals ExpatsCafesRestaurants BarsLike a mini Bangkok without the bookers

Name: Julia G
Title: Not much to do there aka the bureaucrat’s market
Review: The market is small and posh, full of expensive clothes shops and cafes. It is not a good place for travellers who are looking for a real Indian bazaar experience. It is only a nice place if you want to have a good coffee for lots of rupees, otherwise it’s a waste of time. BUT we really enjoyed a stationery around the corner and a man who works there, check it out.

Name: Connoisseur-of-Life
Title: Outdoor but Outstanding
Review: This is our go to market for shopping (Fabindia, Anoki), bookstores, restaurants/bars, grocery stores etc. and just has a great feel about it despite its sometimes decrepit appearance. It has what is labeled ‘character’ and the traders association obviously work hard to keep up standards. It has the soul that the big mega malls do not.

Name: 222_Susie_C
Title: Interesting higher end market
Review: Visited here several times for shopping, ATM and food. Small but perfectly formed. Nice places to eat and the bars are good too. Feels safe. Easy to get to and worth a visit in you are in the area.

Name: Gurpreet S
Title: Amazing place for eating and shopping
Review: The pet shops here are well stocked and the clothes shop named - Banjara - is good. Do bargain a little. Azam’s shop for non veg in the rear lane is the most economical place to eat while standing in the street or else for taking along the packed food. Their Seekh kababs are mouth watering and superbly reasonable at Rs170 for a plate. Khan market offers the best in terms of exotic fruits and vegetables .

Name: LPBfromSunsetBeach
Title: Lots of Shops
Review: A good place to do some shopping in New Delhi. Something neat to see in every little nook and cranny. Fabindia and Cotton are among my favorite clothing shops there.

Name: Amya
Title: Good shopping experience
Review: Fairly small area full of shops, pubs, restaurants and more shops.Stuff you can find: Indian ladies attires, accessories, jewellery, books, toys.Its a clean, beggar and crowd free marketing experience and we as a family loved it.Closest metro: Khan market [5 -10 minutes walk]Do visit the iconic khan chacha for some rolls in the middle of your shopping.

Name: travelgoods
Title: 1 place not to miss on a visit to Delhi!
Review: Who would have thought a odd looking alley way with dogs lying around, a couple of men sitting outside chatting can hide such a rich array of fashion, eateries, and specialist stores.On the outside the market is surrounded by little stores all around the edge selling everything from fragrances, electronics, handbags, pet goods, ( a colleague bought her dog shoes in the market) and the most amazing Home stores. The pastry and cake shops deserve special mention and these rival the best shops around the world. The inner passage plays host to some of Delhi's top fashion designers and well as some of the best restaurants Delhi has to offer. My personal recommendation "The Town hall"  If you were not looking you would walk straight past the little white door on the yellow wall, almost int he center of the market. Do not judge a book by its cover, walk up 2 sets of stairs and be blown away by the amazing, decor, and food that will take your breath away in presentation as well as taste. Do yourself a favor, pop into Khan market for the evening. Go early enough to do shopping before dinner. Make sure you have a reservation to avoid disappointment especially on the weekend. End the evening off with a decadent slice of cheese cake from "The Cakery"Delhi you continue to surprise!!! Khan market, I will be back, I have at least another 40 types of cheesecake to try.

Name: jalG1
Title: Still dreaming of khan market!
Review: Love this place! shoppers paradise with all these hidden cute little shops, such great choices of food, totally in love with this place.

Name: Deepak DB
Title: Best of Both World's
Review: Been to Delhi n number of times but never got a chance to this most talked about market....the super shopping hub before the mall culture took over.There are multiple shops ranging from daily wear to fashion boutiques to international labels selling all the possible things which one would need. The focus is largely on women's fashion. Along with the brands there are shops selling local wares as well (bargain basement kinds).Besides apparels the place houses multiple bars and eateries which are Fine Dine, Premium watering holes to mid range place.One visit as a tourist is a must, especially for women.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The enchanting place for the traveler !
Review: This market is up market place where you can roam and still find good eateries , curio shops , cafes , book stores , apparels and much more . Located within the walking distance from thebeautiful parks , embassies , with tree lined avenues it is a delightful place to discover.

Name: Carlton
Title: Great area to spend an afternoon or evening
Review: Khan market is loaded with food and shopping options that make it a worthy visit for locals and visitors alike. The options are varied, so having a rough plan of what kind of food you want may help narrow down the options. The Big Chill for pizza and ice cream as well as Bahrisons Kid’s bookstore are our favorites, but there are plenty other tempting options including bakeries, barbecue, a beer cafe, and more!

Name: Tamara B
Title: Great Shopping or Afternoon Tea (coffee)
Review: Incredible area for shopping as there are many hi-end shops such as Fabindia, local designer shops, lots of coffee and pastry options along with bargain places for shawls, shoes and jewelry.  Very popular shopping area for ex-Pats that includes a grocery shop that has International foods of quality along with fresh fruits, vegetables, and dairy products.  It's very traditional Indian shopping area versus a Mall type situation.  Great place to stroll and look at shops and people watching.

Name: Vaishali
Title: Enjoyed roaming around
Review: well established...it has most everything to enjoy the evening...could use some cleaning otherwise great place to hang out...

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Very popular and high end market of Delhi
Review: This market is a shoppers delight. You can buy everything which conforms to high quality. You will see many tourists, both Indian and International, every day in this market. You get every kind of restaurant which serve tasty and delicious meals.A must visit place if you are in Delhi.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor Of Mizoram

Name: Ceallachain ☘️
Title: No hustling and not overcrowded
Review: You won’t get shopping malls in Delhi, just markets and little street stalls. Really cool to see, I wouldn’t be the shopping type more of a sight seer, really cool alley ways and lots of hidden gem restaurant and cafes all about in this area! Calm area, no hustlers trying to get you to buy unnecessary cloths or dresses. You can go at your own pace and go wherever you want without the hassle.

Name: Nins
Title: Up-market boutiques!!!
Review: It’s more sophisticated and classy market in Town where you can see creamy crowd. This market has almost everything from clothes, jewelry to furniture  and cafes and restaurants. The food is outstanding.

Name: Satish1949
Title: Good shopping place
Review: Recently we were at this market for few purchases and must admit the market is very attractive market with branded shops and restaurants of various types. Must include in shopping list

Name: MrsRamstad
Title: Great shopping!
Review: We tried the local marked, but found heaven when we got to Khan Market. A lot of great places to eat and shop. The bookshop for children is amazing. Could have spent a whole day there. FabIndia got lovely dresses. If you want the really expensive dresses try - Anita Dongre! Got the most beautiful dresses you can imagine. Nicobar is another shop that I loved. They have great clothes and fab interiour for your home. Do not miss the restaurant Public Affair - great athmosfere and food! And L'Opera for french pastries and macrons. Yes I know it is India, but the local sweets are to sweet.

Name: garychopel
Title: My market KHAN MARKET
Review: such a pretty market in Lutyens zone.. it caters primarily to the diplomatic crowd but is still a fav of delhihites.. u get everything and more here.. the middle lanes are a treasure with many food zones and the famous KHAN Chacha there..

Name: 123susan456
Title: Upscale shopping  center
Review: Kahn market is a nice area to walk around to shop, or to have coffee at one of the many French type pastry shops that are quite incredible.   Restaurants,  many optical shops with designer brands.

Name: TYPSUKR
Title: Popular Shopping Center
Review: It was raining when we visited, so we didn't get to spend as much time as I would have liked. The stores here clearly cater to an upper-middle class clientele (including one of the only two Starbucks I saw in New Delhi). Some of the stores are fairly traditional (i.e. selling books and paper products) while some others, particularly the restaurants, could have been something that you'd find in the United States. Neat to visit, but be sure to do some research (about the various shops) before visiting to make the best use of your time.

Name: PFTraveller62
Title: Shopping Area
Review: More of a shopping area than a market. A mixture of trendy local shops and western ones like  M&S lingerie and Hamleys. Was looking more for markets selling local clothing. Noticed a few local restaurants and bars typically on the second floors.

Name: newyorknytrip
Title: Trendy Shopping Centre
Review: Khan Market has been, and continues to be a premier shopping centre in New Delhi.It has it all, be it elite restaurants, eateries, quality meatshops, or high end stores selling a plethora of goods ranging from attire, footwear, bags,and accessories to daily necessities. It does not end here-the inner lanes and bylanes are filled with stalls selling fashion items at affordable rates.Additionally, Khan Market's Lok Nayak Bhawan is a one stop destination for fancy lights and fittings which are available at competitive rates.To top it all, it is a popular and elite shopping area where one can see everyone sporting the latest fashion trends! Indeed an interesting place to visit in New Delhi.

Name: gauth333
Title: Crazy....Don't know for what
Review: Located in Luyetn's Delhi area  the market is highly over rated. Place has cramped parking space and there is traffic jam almost always during peak hours. There are some good eating joints and shopping places but almost every where stuff you buy are overpriced. Layout of the market is not extraordinary. I would not consider this a must do when visiting Delhi but it can be a place to splurge out extra cash if you don;t know what to do with 'em.

Name: The Lodge at Manor Barn
Title: Over rated
Review: Don’t bother with this place as it’s distinctly average . A parade of low grade shops with the odd high end one mainly sun glasses , most odd .Back street restaurants which felt very touristy. Give it a miss

Name: Elizabeth V
Title: Very over rated
Review: Supposed to be a collection of shops and restaurants.  Shops were cheap and tacky (belonged on Blackpool promenade) apart from Marks & Spencer lingerie shop.  Restaurants were also over-sold and dirty.  Disappointed and wished we hadn't visited.  Packed out with tourists who seemed to be gawping/window shopping, and not helping the local economy.

Name: Carole J
Title: Fun mix of locals and tourists
Review: A haven after the hassles of tourist Delhi.  Great book shop, and good local eateries.  Beware tuk tuk drivers who tell you it is closed!

Name: my2cents2day
Title: The spot for great series of restaurants
Review: At first we were looking for a market but really we found a Restaurant strip without habituel touts harassing you every 3 seconds like Connaught AreaAnd we discovered in our opinion the spot named The Chatter House.It has a large sign in alley way and is located on the 2nd floorLet your eyes and taste buds figure out the rest... what a menu and what a chefPs im writing you 3 days after going..It was really perfect and safe.When you finish there go to the Big chill bakery for desert...around the cornerMy2cents

Name: Ravi
Title: Small but cozy
Review: A nice small cozy place. Good for hangouts with friends and colleaguesYou can find very pub, restaurant, find dine area. Good for hangouts in eveningYou can enjoy shopping here specially boutique, books and some crafts etc. However, the stuffs are quite costly here

Name: Vinod A
Title: Great food
Review: It is always a pleasure to visit this restaurant and enjoy authentic Chineese cuisine. Their consistent standard of food and service keep taking us there off and on whenever we are in mood to have Chineese food. Great place. Only negative point is the location on 1st and 2nd floor. Otherwise good ambience !!

Name: Cain R
Title: A vacation from the vacation
Review: Love this area.Everything's so familiar here.You don't get chased by drivers and sellers.You can find whatever food you're looking for or buy whatever branded goods you like.This has low key and high key locations in a very compact area.Coffee shops, bars and restaurants are plenty here and it's pretty clean.We were tired of all the chicken and curry and vegan food so we came here for a break.So great place to have a breather.

Name: ChelzeannK22
Title: Boutique Shopping in Khan Market
Review: If you have stepped foot near Chandni Chowk, Khan Market will feel like a breath of fresh air. The scene is much less chaotic and is packed full of small boutiques just begging for attention. Big Chill seems to be the "IT" place to grab food, I didn't have time to stop in to eat but there was a line of patrons waiting for a table, which always seems like a good sign!

Name: francc
Title: Great and Wide Selection
Review: A large collection of shophouses offering everything from premium fresh fruit andvegetables to trendy cafes and restaurants , slippers to tailors , brass souvenirs to designer labels. A good feel of what local daily shopping is for upper middle class delhites ! Lots of well priced and interesting locally made gifts to be bought ! Many Good Cafes and Restaurants. A generous amount of car park lots too.

Name: MvdK01
Title: Luxury shops but dirty area
Review: I don’t get it. Khan Market is having all kinds of really high end shops and restaurants and yet the area is crowded, not organised, and it feels uncomfortable in the evenings. This place needs an urgent make-over to be able to compete with the shopping malls who have the same shops and restaurants, as those are usually chains.

Name: aquabell
Title: Upmarket shopping restaurant and tailors
Review: My second visit to Delhi and i again found myself drawn back to Khan Market as it just has everything. Jacket made at Grovers. Shirts for my husband and myself at B Rai and sons. Lovely toiletries shower gel etc at forest essentials-and Karma. Great restaurant. Try the cocktails and mac cheese croquettes at Sly Granny. Great modern indian food at Baar Baar a pop up restaurant from New York.

Name: Sonali M
Title: Great shops and ambience
Review: Khan Market is always bustling with people. It has a great variety of shops, ranging from those unique to the market to high-end designer wear. There are clothing stores, jewelry stores, make-up , skin and hair-care stores, bookstores and more. There is also great variety and quality in the eating places, from Indian food to Chinese, Italian and more.Townhall is excellent for food and ambience, The Big Chills restaurant, cafe, and cakery all have amazing food, drink, and desserts.

Name: Gan S
Title: One stop visit
Review: Has just about everything you need. Lots of high end and international brands. Chich cafes and artisan grocery stores complete the menu. Parking is a nightmare especially on Sundays. Surroundings, as with the rest of Delhi are dirty and unkempt.

Name: Evie
Title: Total quality and no traffic!
Review: We went to Khan Market specifically to have a massage at Spa55, which was totally fabulous, but the whole experience was a delight to walk this chic and very up-Market market! There is no traffic inside the market which makes a nice change and all the offerings are very high end and beautiful! Don’t expect a super bargain in Khan Market but do expect tasteful and quality!

Name: lutl88
Title: Upmarket part of Delhi to eat/shop
Review: Corridor of dining places and shops, presumably for white-collar crowd. Kebabs and cafes were excellent. Besides that, nothing remarkable.

Name: FredYin
Title: Posh - by Delhi standards
Review: relatively expensive but good quality shops. Not a big area so maybe spend 1-2 hours is enough to see the whole thing.

Name: Dev
Title: Must taste once
Review: The Mughlai chicken and mutton items are very delicious here. Once tasted definitely you will come back again. Slightly expensive than other restaurants.

Name: megpage2015
Title: Bit confusing but a pleasant place to visit
Review: Told its a must do for Delhi shopping. Store fronts are quite narrow so you need to know your local brands to want to go in. Luxury brands same same as anywhere else. Loved how the stray dogs hung out just near the petshop door. Khan Chacha saved the market rating for me

Name: anjan m
Title: Highly expensive shops
Review: You get good choice and quality stuff but it is an expensive market. Restaurants are classy and serves excellent international menu.

Name: Christopher B
Title: The Great Escape: Of Your Money
Review: I never fail to visit Khan Market on my visits to New Delhi! I love the cheese cakes, chocolates, books, high-end food markets and cosmetics! I like the fancy shops, bustle and just plain fun!

Name: FrequentFlier427747
Title: Oho ! Its like a noise hevan !! Wow 😮
Review: Aap jahan ho bus khush rehte ho ,aisa lagta hain yahi hain right choice baby !! Peeche wali gali jo hamesha heat create karti hain becouse of so many AC ... but its a real world of lots of restaurants.. keep jump a world of happiness
